name: Sinuosity
functionStatement: Examines the role of bank processes and erosion in channel change. Observes patterns in sinuosity and curvature affecting habitat complexity.
descriptionMarkdown: Ratio of channel length to valley length; higher sinuosity indicates greater curvature and habitat variety.
howToMeasureMarkdown: Compute channel centerline length divided by valley length in GIS.

levels.label: Strongly Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Channelized or straight through a meander belt.
Criteria: Sinuosity <1.05 where meanders are expected.

levels.label: Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Mostly straight with infrequent bends.
Criteria: Sinuosity ~1.05-1.1.

levels.label: Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Gentle bends with long straight runs.
Criteria: Sinuosity ~1.1-1.2.

levels.label: Strongly Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Meanders occupy valley floor; bars well developed.
Criteria: Sinuosity ~1.2-1.5 or matches local reference.
